newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - April 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - April 7.

text.p: The following stories appeared in Monday's Daily Variety:

* Universal's Liar Liar remained unbeatable for a third consecutive weekend, slipping just 27 percent to $18.5 million and maintaining a comfortable lead over Paramount's The Saint, which had sales of $16.1 million.
* NYNEX and Bell Atlantic have backed away from joining forces with News Corp. and EchoStar Communications in the ASkyB satellite TV venture.
* General Electric's NBC has picked up its freshman comedy Suddenly Susan for a second year with a 22-episode order.
* Ed Harris has replaced Dennis Hopper in Paramount Pictures' "The Truman Show" after the filmmakers and the actor split over "creative differences", sources said.
* In a letter to president of the Motion Pictures Association Jack Valenti, three U.S. senators told the television industry Friday to rewrite its content code or Congress would do it for them.

* U.S. program suppliers are upbeat heading to the Mip TV trade show, which opens in Cannes on Friday. Despite startup snafus in Germany and Japan, the launch of digital platforms abroad is unlocking more outlets for their product.
